title: Adobe Copyright Font, what is it?
content:
So, I’ve been trying to find this font for hours now, and sadly, i am forced to leave it in the hands of the Typophile community (already burned two hours on this, need to get back to work lol)

I’m looking for the font seen on the startup splashes for Adobe CS4 programs (Photoshop, Flash, etc). Not Myriad Pro, but the copyright information font on the bottom.

I’ve attached a link to a screenshot of what i’m talking about. Area in question is highlighted.

[FlashSplash.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/27977526@N07/4147490630/sizes/o/)  
Thanks for the help typophiles!
author: redtens

comments.content:
Update!

This is really close to what i’m looking for, but its in .fon format, and i’m on a mac =/.  
 [HaxrCorp S8](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611/http:/www.dafont.com/haxrcorp-s8.font?nb_ppp=50&text=Copyright+Adobe+International)

I think you’re right to look at Bitmap fonts. Did you search for ’Bitmap’ at MyFonts?

- Mike Yanega

[MiniFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611/http:/new.myfonts.com/foundry/MiniFonts.com/) has 58 fonts, some very close to this, and they seem to come in TT for PC and Mac.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks for the help Mike!

Yeah, was searching through MyFonts like you suggested, and MiniFonts has 3 or 4 that come really close. I’ll probably end up using one of those, but i’d like to know what Adobe used for this, just out of curiosity.

Thanks again!

A side note: the “Fl ADOBE FLASH CS4 PROFESSIONAL” text is not Myriad Pro, but [Adobe Clean](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2009/05/a_new_face_for_1.html).
oh. lol oops! Guess you learn something new every day, thanks Cris!

Uh, I don’t think they used a bitmap font. Are you on Windows? On the Mac it looks like this:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AIstart_6095.jpg)
  
I would guess it’s Adobe Clean too.

screenshot of flash CS4 (linked above) was taken on a mac.

i guess the copyright on the flash startup is a different font?

here’s a close-up of the font (capture taken from “About Flash CS4” on osx)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-2_5954.jpg)

Well, looks like I found it. Don’t know if this is the original font, but there’s a .ttf that someone made of a windows bitmap font (.fon) called [HaxrCorp](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611/http:/fontstruct.fontshop.com/fontstructions/show/228466).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611im_/http:/typophile.com/files/haxrcorp_s80_5340.png)
Ouch, I’m sorry. I assumed the type would be the same for all the CS4 apps. Weird.

By now you know that the typeface you were looking for is Adobe Clean; this gives some additional information:

[http://blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2009/05/a\_new\_face\_for\_1.html#more](http://web.archive.org/web/20091201203611/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2009/05/a_new_face_for_1.html#more "http://blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2009/05/a\_new\_face\_for\_1.html#more")
